title: Cylinder Head - Installation

body.body: Make sure that the engine is securely mounted in an engine stand or properly supported when it is removed from the motorcycle.
If the engine is not correctly supported, it can fall.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in damage to property or serious injury.
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Fit a new cylinder head gasket. Make sure that the head to crankcase location dowels are correctly in position.
Make sure that the cylinder head face is completely clean.
Carefully lower the cylinder head over the camshaft drive chain and locate the head onto the dowels.
Use the correct procedure to install and tighten the cylinder head bolts. If you do not, early failure of the cylinder head gasket can occur.
Fully clean each bolt, especially the threads. If any threads are damaged, replace the bolt(s).
Apply a thin layer of engine oil to the threads of the bolts and then wipe clean with a lint-free cloth.
Use the three-stage procedure that follows, to tighten the bolts.
Failure to follow these important conditions can lead to engine damage because of a damaged head gasket.
You must install new cylinder head bolts and washers.
Lubricate the threads on the new bolts and the top surface of the new hardened washers with clean engine oil.
Fit the new bolts and washers to the cylinder head as noted for removal and tighten until finger tight.
The cylinder head bolts are tightened in four stages, in the sequence shown below. This is to make sure that the cylinder head gasket seals correctly to the head and crankcase.
For stages one, two and four of the cylinder head tightening operation, you must use a torque wrench of known, accurate calibration.
For stage three of the cylinder head tightening operation, you must turn the bolts through a set number of degrees to reach the final setting. To accurately gauge the turn, use
Tighten the cylinder head bolts to

between the Torx socket and the drive handle and locate the Torx drive to the bolt. Pick an increment point on the torque turn gauge which aligns with a suitable reference point on the head.

of bolt rotation as measured using the

Fit the screws that attach the side of the cylinder head to the crankcase and tighten to

body.name: Cylinder head outside two screws cdra_1

body.body: Cylinder head to upper crankcase screws
Install the camshaft drive chain tensioner blades.
Clean and lubricate the tappet buckets with a 50/50 solution of engine oil and molybdenum disulphide grease and refit the buckets and shims in the same locations from which they were removed.

Fit a new cylinder head gasket. Make sure that the head to crankcase location dowels are correctly in position.
Cylinder head gasket
Make sure that the cylinder head face is completely clean.
Carefully lower the cylinder head over the camshaft drive chain and locate the head onto the dowels.
Use the correct procedure to install and tighten the cylinder head bolts. If you do not, early failure of the cylinder head gasket can occur.
Fully clean each bolt, especially the threads. If any threads are damaged, replace the bolt(s).
Apply a thin layer of engine oil to the threads of the bolts and then wipe clean with a lint-free cloth.
Use the three-stage procedure that follows, to tighten the bolts.
Failure to follow these important conditions can lead to engine damage because of a damaged head gasket.
You must install new cylinder head bolts and washers.
Lubricate the threads on the new bolts and the top surface of the new hardened washers with clean engine oil.
Fit the new bolts and washers to the cylinder head as noted for removal and tighten until finger tight.
The cylinder head bolts are tightened in four stages, in the sequence shown below. This is to make sure that the cylinder head gasket seals correctly to the head and crankcase.
For stages one, two and four of the cylinder head tightening operation, you must use a torque wrench of known, accurate calibration.
For stage three of the cylinder head tightening operation, you must turn the bolts through a set number of degrees to reach the final setting. To accurately gauge the turn, use
T3880105 - Torque Angle Gauge

Install the camshaft drive chain tensioner blades.
Clean and lubricate the tappet buckets with a 50/50 solution of engine oil and molybdenum disulphide grease and refit the buckets and shims in the same locations from which they were removed.
